revised_title: Flash Photolysis of Sulphur Dioxide and Sulphur Trioxide
tldr: The authors studied the flash photolysis of sulfur dioxide and sulfur trioxide, observing the absorption spectrum of SO and the effects of thermal energy on the molecules. They discovered that the flash photolysis of sulfur dioxide results in the temporary disappearance of its spectrum, which then slowly regains its original intensity. The isothermal flash photolysis of sulfur trioxide also produces vibrationally excited SO, and the primary photochemical step in this reaction is discussed. The findings contribute to the understanding of the properties and behavior of these molecules under specific conditions.
